Package Alicisindan

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • Alicisindan.User
  • public class User
extends java.lang.Object
    User class. Includes every User getter and setter methods. You can register an User to the system by giving its credentials to the server. You can get data of an already registered User from the system by providing an id. You can change various details of an User by providing an id and password. All getters and setters are non-static. Password and key data is not stored within the User object. Images are not stored within the User object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • User

        public User​(java.lang.String username,
            java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.String surname,
            java.lang.String birthdate,
            java.lang.String address,
            java.lang.String email,
            java.lang.String phone)
        Secondary constructor, for creating the User object BEFORE REGISTERATION. Password and Image data are not stored within the User object!
        Parameters:
        username - Username of the user.
        name - Name(s) of the user.
        surname - Surname of the user.
        birthdate - Birthdate of the user in the format of epoch time in milliseconds.
        address - Address of the user.
        email - Email of the user.
        phone - Phone number of the user.

    • Method Detail

      • registerUser

        public void registerUser​(java.lang.String password)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Registers an user object to the database.CREATES A NEW ID INDEPENDENT ON WHATEVER ID THE CURRENT OBJECT HAS!! THEREFORE, CAN'T BE USED TO MAKE CHANGES TO AN EXISTING USER!! Already checks for username, email and phone existence on the server but make sure to check beforehands anyway. Doesn't upload images! The ID and registeration date parameters are not sent and are created in the server!
        Parameters:
        password - of user.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when socket returns unexpected response.

      • getUser

        public static User getUser​(java.lang.String id)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns a new User object that is imported from database. The data user set as private won't be accessed and will be seen as "*". To access such data, use the getUserWithPassword method.
        Parameters:
        id - of user
        Returns:
        User object imported from database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when socket returns unexpected response.

      • getUserWithPassowrd

        public static User getUserWithPassowrd​(java.lang.String id,
                                       java.lang.String password)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns a new User object that is imported from database. This method also sends the password to the database and uses a different Request type. The data user set as private can be accessed by this method.
        Parameters:
        id - of user
        password - of user
        Returns:
        User object imported from database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when socket returns unexpected response.

      • findUsers

        public static User[] findUsers​(java.lang.String searchedUsername,
                               java.lang.String order,
                               java.lang.String offset,
                               java.lang.String limit)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Searches for User objects in database. For any parameter, use the null keywoard for no filter.
        Parameters:
        searchedUsername - to filter for.
        order - to get users with. POSSIBLE INPUTS: User.NEWESTFIRST, User.OLDESTFIRST
        offset - Number of listings to skip while getting listings.
        limit - Number of listigns to get.
        Returns:
        Array of User objects.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when socket returns unexpected response.

      • findUserIDs

        public static java.lang.String[] findUserIDs​(java.lang.String searchedUsername,
                                             java.lang.String order,
                                             java.lang.String offset,
                                             java.lang.String limit)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Searches for User objects in database. For any parameter, use the null keywoard for no filter.
        Parameters:
        searchedUsername - to filter for.
        order - to get users with. POSSIBLE INPUTS: User.NEWESTFIRST, User.OLDESTFIRST
        offset - Number of listings to skip while getting listings.
        limit - Number of listigns to get.
        Returns:
        Array of User ids.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when socket returns unexpected response.
